definition-item.definition-title: SOLAR HEAT COLLECTORS; SOLAR HEAT SYSTEMS (for producing mechanical power from solar energy F03G6/00)

section-body.paragraph-text: This place does not cover:

table-column.paragraph-text: Devices for producing mechanical power from solar energy

section-body.paragraph-text: Examples of places where the subject matter of this place is covered when specially adapted, used for a particular purpose, or incorporated in a larger system:

table-column.paragraph-text: Distillation or evaporation of water using solar energy
Drying solid materials or objects by radiation, e.g. from the sun
Thermophotovoltaic systems
Photovoltaic [PV] modules including means associated with the PV module to utilise heat energy
Photovoltaic [PV] cells including means directly associated with the PV cell to utilise heat energy

section-body.paragraph-text: Attention is drawn to the following places, which may be of interest for search:

table-column.paragraph-text: Semiconductor devices specially adapted for converting solar energy into electrical energy

section-body.paragraph-text: In this place, the following terms or expressions are used with the meaning indicated:

table-column.paragraph-text: Solar heat collector modules
whole solar heat collectors; part of solar heat collectors, e.g. reflectors, lens or heat storages
Absorbing elements
elements for absorbing solar-ray and converting it into heat
Solar heat systems
systems having solar heat collectors as their components and using the collected heat

definition-item.definition-title: having two or more passages for the same working fluid layered in direction of solar-rays, e.g. having upper circulation channels connected with lower circulation channels
